array.name: tourist_places_description
array.item: The Pyramids of Giza are Cairo\'s number one half-day trip and a must-do attraction on everyone\'s itinerary. Right on the edge of the city, these fourth dynasty funerary temples have been wowing travelers for centuries and continue to be one of the country\'s major highlights. Despite the heat, the dust, and the tourist hustle, you can\'t miss a trip here.

The absolutely staggering collection of antiquities displayed in Cairo\'s Egyptian Museum makes it one of the world\'s great museums. You would need a lifetime to see everything on show. The museum was founded in 1857 by French Egyptologist August Mariette and moved to its current home - in the distinctive powder-pink mansion in Downtown Cairo - in 1897.
Al-Azhar Mosque is the finest building of Cairo\'s Fatimid era, and one of the city\'s earliest surviving mosques, completed in AD 972. It\'s also one of the world\'s oldest universities.

This small church-filled cluster of twisty laneways lies within the walls of Old Babylon where the Roman Emperor Trajan first built a fortress along the Nile. Parts of the Roman towers still preside over the main street.

Khan el-Khalili is one of the world\'s great shopping experiences. This Middle Eastern souq (bazaar) is a labyrinthine collection of skinny alleyways established as a shopping district in AD 1400 that still rings with the clang of metal workers and silversmiths.
In a commanding location at the foot of the Mokattam Hills, Cairo\'s citadel was built by Saladin in 1176.

One of the finest examples of Mamluk architecture in the world, Sultan Hassan Mosque is a vision of Arabic artistry with an abundance of stalactite detailing and intricate arabesque features. It was built in 1356-63 for the Sultan Hassan el-Nasir.

Of all the Islamic Cairo district\'s gates, Bab Zuweila is the most interesting. You can climb to the top of this medieval era relic (built in the 11th century) for some amazing rooftop views over Islamic Cairo.

The northern section of Al-Muizz li-Din Allah Street is rimmed by fine Mamluk buildings that have been painstakingly restored to their former glory. The Madrassa of as-Salih Ayyub, built in 1247, is a showcase of the tranquil simplicity of Islamic architecture.

The second oldest mosque still standing in Cairo, Ibn Tulun Mosque, was built between AD 876 and 879 and modeled on the Kaaba in Mecca (Saudi Arabia). At the time it was built, it was the largest mosque in existence.

The Nile island of Gezira is home to the district of Zamalek and the majority of Cairo\'s arty boutiques and hipster restaurants. Dating from the mid 19th century, the entire area has a distinctly European feel to its architecture with wide boulevards rimmed by Jacaranda trees and splendidly ornate Belle Ã‰poque mansions (many of which are now home to various embassies).

Lovely Roda Island - just south of Gezira Island - is home to Monastirli Palace, once the residence of an Ottoman pasha. Inside the palace gardens, right at the island\'s southern tip, is Cairo\'s Nilometer - that was used to measure the ebb and flow of the Nile and predict the annual flood heights.

Caliph Al-Hakim is one of the most fascinating rulers of Egypt. This Fatimid leader was renowned for his terrifying rule over the land, which included frequent murders of his royal household staff, nightly patrols of the streets of his city dressed incognito on a donkey to make sure his subjects were behaving themselves, and issuing bizarre rulings across the country (such as banning the eating of the Egyptian mallow-leaf called molokheya because only he wanted to be able to consume it).

If you want to capture a sense of late 19th-century Cairo when the city was nicknamed the "Paris of the East" take a stroll through the downtown district with your gaze diverted up at the car-exhaust blackened architecture rather than on the bedlam at street level.
The vast necropolis of Saqqara is home to the "other pyramids" and a day trip out here is just as rewarding as a trip to Giza\'s pyramids. Location: 30 kms south of Cairo
The Synagogue is an incredible example of the diversity of architecture in Cairo and represents a myriad of different styles (Baroque, Art Deco) in bas relief with overlays of Pharonic Art.

array.name: hotel_names
array.item: Grand Nile Tower (Formerly Grand Hyatt Cairo)
Cairo Marriott Hotel Omar Khayyam Casino
Mena House Hotel (Formerly Mena House Oberoi)

array.name: hotel_descriptions
array.item: Overlooking the Nile and the Pyramids of Giza, this 5-star floating hotel features free Wi-Fi, an outdoor pool and a sundeck with a bar. It is 5 minutes? walk from local shopping outlets. A minibar, satellite TV and safety deposit box are equipped in all of Golden Boat Floating Hotel?s units.

Al Masah Hotel and Spa features a terrace with a swimming pool. Located in the green area of Nasr City, it offers 5 restaurants and a wellness centre. All the elegant rooms have a balcony. All the rooms and suites at Al Masah have views of the terrace, the garden or the pool.

Featuring views of the great Pyramids, this resort on the edge of Cairo offers a charming pool garden. Its 5 dining options include a buffet restaurant with live piano music. The air-conditioned rooms at Cataract Pyramids are spacious and equipped with satellite TVs and minibars.
Le Passage Cairo is only 2-minutes from the Cairo International Airport in Cairo?s Heliopolis district. The hotel offers fine restaurants, a discotheque and a casino.

Situated in one of Cairo s affluent districts- Heliopolis, the Gabriel?s design is inspired by classical era and is decorated with warm colours. It offers modern accommodation with free Wi-Fi, an outdoor pool and a retail arcade.

Pyramids Park Resort Cairo is set in 25 acres of gardens, just 5 minutes drive from the Pyramids. It has a 1750 square metre pool and all its rooms have balconies. All the rooms at Pyramids Park are air conditioned and cable TV.

This stylish and contemporary 5-star hotel, situated in New Cairo, offers luxurious accommodation in a sanctuary of tranquillity with an excellent location setting. Dusit Thani is only about a 20-minute drive from Cairo Airport. It has easy access to many tourist attractions

Featuring luxury accommodation with free Wi-Fi, this 5-star hotel is located 10 minutes? drive from Cairo International Airport. It boasts a pool, fitness centre and restaurant. Heliopolis is 10 minutes away by car. Furnished with an elegant dÃ©cor

Located in the Nile City Towers by the River Nile, this 5-star hotel features a rooftop pool deck with spectacular views across Cairo to the Pyramids. It offers 8 food and beverage venues. All of this Fairmont Hotel?s soundproofed rooms are decorated with elegant Art Deco furnishings.

Luxurious rooms and suites offer views across the River Nile at Grand Nile Tower on Roda Island. The wellness centre also overlooks the Nile and the resort features 8 restaurants and an outdoor pool. The elegantly decorated rooms and suites at Grand Nile Tower come with a work desk, satellite TV and minibar.

Situated in Cairo\'s affluent Garden City district, Kempinski Hotel offers luxurious rooms on the shores of the Nile River. It features a wellness centre and a rooftop swimming pool. Each of Kempinski\'s rooms is fitted with soundproofed windows, free Wi-Fi and high definition LCD TVs with satellite channels.

A 10-minute walk from the Nile River embankment, Safir hotel in Cairo\'s city centre offers luxurious rooms with balconies. It features an outdoor pool, gym and free Wi-Fi in public areas. Each air-conditioned room is spacious and includes a work desk, satellite TV and minibar.

Located in Cairo\'s Zamalek district, the Marriott Omar Khayyam offers luxurious rooms with a balcony. It features an outdoor swimming pool, a casino and 14 food and beverage outlets. All guest rooms at the Cairo Marriott feature satellite TV, a minibar, tea/coffee facilities and elegant bathrooms.

Overlooking the Great Pyramids of Giza, this hotel is surrounded by 40 acres of green gardens and has a spa, fitness centre and a pool. The rooms are decorated with handcrafted furniture. All accommodations at Mena House Hotel have air conditioning and include luxurious fabrics, a seating area and LCD TV.

Located in Cairo?s stylish Heliopolis district, the 5-star Radisson Blu offers a rooftop pool with panoramic Cairo views. It has an extensive daily breakfast buffet, free Wi-Fi and in-room LCD TVs. Guest rooms at Radisson Blu Hotel Cairo Heliopolis feature modern dÃ©cor, Select Comfort beds and a seating area.

Fairmont Heliopolis features 3 tennis courts, and a hot tub. It has 3 swimming pools surrounded by a landscaped garden. Free Wi-Fi is available in all rooms. All rooms feature touches of Egyptian heritage in their dÃ©cor. Each air-conditioned rooms has flat-screen TV, a minibar and a work desk.

Just a 25-minute drive from City Centre, Concorde El Salam Hotel Cairo is 6 km from fashionable Heliopolis suburb. It features 9 restaurants, 2 outdoor pools, and private stables. The rooms include flat-screen TVs and free Wi-Fi.

Situated in the Heliopolis neighbourhood, this 5-star hotel is a 10-minute drive from Cairo Airport. It has 3 swimming pools, a modern fitness centre, and spacious rooms with luxury bedding. Rooms at Fairmont Towers have parquet floors and floor-to-ceiling windows with city and garden views.

Located in Nasr City residential area and a 10-minute drive from the airport, Sonesta Hotel boasts 5 restaurants and 4 bars. It features an outdoor swimming pool and sun terrace. All air-conditioned rooms at the Sonesta Hotel Tower and Casino Cairo are spacious and elegantly decorated.

array.name: parks_descriptions
array.item: The Nile River is simply everything you expect it to be! Gorgeous and large, it is bound to take your breath away and show you how amazing nature is.

it\'s a very beautiful well organized park, it has a variety of roses, flowers and trees , and with some soft music at night which makes it so romantic , the restaurant studio Masr is a great value to the place with it\'s Islamic architecture style which build with stones , and the food is amazing , if you sit at the terrace you can see the magnificent citadel with Mohamed Ali mosque on top of it and great sultan Hassan mosque and Madrasa with it\'s 84 m high minaret all these gives you a great skyline.
This island is located in the Nile River between downtown Cairo and Giza, and is characterized by upscale hotels, restaurants and pleasant gardens.
It really is - it is quiet, calm, a nice little park, shady, and the breeze from the Nile is fabulous.

Just a few minutes from chaotic Cairo traffic, you can find this treasure of nature. Easy to rich by taxi, entrance 5 le for foreigners, if you want to enter by car you will pay 10 le. There is possibility to overnight in tent. You can consider this as five billion stars hotel
We went there at night.. There are some cafÃ©s and restaurants with a great view of the city.. The view at night is amazing..
We found Djed Egypt Travel to take us on a 6 days desert safari in Western Desert. Guide and drivers were enchanting. We enjoyed their attention and brilliant cooking.
This is a beautiful theme garden near the edge of what once was a beautiful winter escape from Cairo.

the zoo is so big, has lots type of animals lions, Indian and African elephants, nile crocodiles, seals, lion sea, polar bear, bears, white rhino, giraffes, monkeys, camels. Very nice place to visit, i ,love animal life and this zoo is full of it, we had our private guide and he made things easy for us, it is a place to go again.
To enjoy horse racing and international horse racing, you should visit this place
one of the best heritage islamic places
This place used to be the pleasant Gabalaya Park and Aquarium, that landscaped gardens with aquariums set in rocks (though not many actual fish), however.
